title: Assassin mains are the most respected people in this game.
body:
> Their class is squishy and doesn't have a specific role dedicated to babysitting them in lane.
> Their class is based upon getting a lead in the lane, meaning that they must outplay their oponent to get fed.
> There are multiple cases of which assassins can't get back into the game (minus a few exceptions)
> Assassin mains are some of the chillest and most skillfull players in this game.

Respect the assassin mains, if they manage to take out a high priority target at the clutch time, they essentially won the game. Assassin mains are the unsung heroes of League.

replies.body: Why are you a jerk? Are you a flamer? Or does your play rubs people the wrong way? (Landing a clean Fizz ult + combo) or (Zhonyas into Ekko stun + into a Chronobreak triple kill?)

Assassin mains are the players i hate the most, they choose to main the most selfish class in the game, one that focuses on kills entirely because ''kills is all that matters lolz''

They pick champions that are utterly useless to the team comp unless they get themselves fed. Hell, i'd take a 0/20 Veigar over a 0/0 Zed, at least the Veig can still f*ck up a teamfight with a well placed stun.

They're often the most arrogant players, flashing their Mastery 7 emote on their main Fizz because ohhhh they're so skilled for one-shotting you after landed their ult that's just as wide as the lane.

They get 15 kills and then blame their teammates for losing the game, not realizing that kills are not what matters the most, and that their contribution over taking objectives is utter crap.

Now see this is just someone who doesn't understand the assassin class.

> Assassin mains are the players i hate the most, they choose to main the most selfish class in the game, one that focuses on kills entirely because ''kills is all that matters lolz''

The "most selfish class in the game" huh? Assassin's aren't just pure 1v1 champions and anyone who plays them that way is wrong. They use the pressure from their 1v1 ability to get vision control and roam specifically to help other lanes. If I had to pick a selfish class I would say adc is up there since they take most of the resources from their team (of course they can also carry the mid to late game in return if you get them ahead) and need the most help at all stages of the game.

> They pick champions that are utterly useless to the team comp unless they get themselves fed. Hell, i'd take a 0/20 Veigar over a 0/0 Zed, at least the Veig can still f*ck up a teamfight with a well placed stun.

The threat of a diving champion is a pretty big help to the team, the adc is forced to play safer and/or have a peeler close by constantly. Sure they don't bring cc normally, but acting like they can't roam, split push, get picks, etc is just ignorant.

> They're often the most arrogant players, flashing their Mastery 7 emote on their main Fizz because ohhhh they're so skilled for one-shotting you after landed their ult that's just as wide as the lane.

I usually save the emote for 2v1's or other close scenarios to tilt the other player. It might not be the nicest thing, but I do it on all champion when I outplay them not just assassins. There is always a mute button if you can't control your tilt.

> They get 15 kills and then blame their teammates for losing the game, not realizing that kills are not what matters the most, and that their contribution over taking objectives is utter crap.

The only time I give my team shit is when I say something like "I'm going to push bot, when they send 2-3 do baron" then the support decides to run into the enemy jungle for wards when we don't see anyone, dies, and we lose baron because I'm bot. You could've easily warded after I reached their tower or we saw people on the map...
